result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid - 2nd+ offense [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation apply to both counts.  Concurrent with 14-CM-211.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.  Cash bond applied.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample of file with the State of Wisconsin and must pay the DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, ready to proceed to plea/sentencing today.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Joshua J. Franklin in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Joshua J. Franklin in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Joshua J. Franklin appears by video conference along with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears in person.  Defendant Joshua J. Franklin in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he was ill and fell asleep with the medication he is taking, that's why he missed his court date. State requests additional cash be posted in 14-CM-211 and 14-CT-069. State not requesting any additional cash in this file. Atty Schaefer gives argument on bond. Bond remains in effect as previously set in this file.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
